ThingDef.label: Illuminate Pistol
ThingDef.description: A common Illuminate pattern pistol. Unlike its Terran counterparts this weapon uses coil-based acceleration. Whilst It has more accuracy and a shorter travel time than a Terran auto pistol, it hits with less power when compared to one.

ThingDef.label: Illuminate SMG
ThingDef.description: A coil-based Illuminate SMG. Whilst it does theoretically have a better service range compared to its Terran counterparts, this weapon is best used for medium to short ranged engagements. Besides this fact, it still has two qualities that make it reliable—its accuracy and travel time.

ThingDef.label: Illuminate Rifle
ThingDef.description: A common Illuminate pattern rifle. Praised by both soldiers and hunters for its reliability, it is practically standard issue for any weaponized operation. Its high range and very short travel time makes it perfect for picking off distant enemies.

ThingDef.label: Illuminate Sniper Rifle
ThingDef.description: A high-powered Illuminate pattern sniper rifle. This sophisticated weapon optimizes the use of Helium-cooling to keep its powerful and plentiful coils from overheating in it’s user’s talons. With its long range and powerful bullet, it is highly loved by Illuminate snipers for picking off high-value targets with.

ThingDef.label: Illuminate Shotgun
ThingDef.description: An Illuminate Pattern shotgun. Together with its advanced coil technology and a simple choke at the end, it fires a highly concentrated wad of pellets towards its enemies. Whilst longer range than its Terran counterparts, it has to trade in short range usability to make this possible.

ThingDef.label: Illuminate Rocket Launcher
ThingDef.description: An Illuminate rocket launcher. Anti-Tank weapons are important in any war, and this rocket launcher is no different. Using a fin-stabilized system together with a small jet system, this rocket ensures you hit where you aim. Despite its good range, near-perfect accuracy and high-explosive payload. It fires a slow and easy to dodge projectile and should be used with good prior planning.

ThingDef.label: Independent Worlds Pistol
ThingDef.description: A simple non-Illuminate pistol. Whilst dealing less damage and having a slightly shorter range when compared to its Terran counterpart, it makes up for this by using coil technology for a better firing rate and more medium range viability.

ThingDef.label: Independent Worlds battle rifle
ThingDef.description: A popular non-Illuminate battle rifle. The design of these simple rifles has quickly spread throughout the Rimworld to offer Avali both defensive and hunting capacities. Together with a regular old blowback-action design and its fast but small bullet, it brings a decent fire-rate and equally decent range to the table.

ThingDef.label: Independent Worlds rifle
ThingDef.description: A bolt-action non-Illuminate rifle. Whilst this weapon has a lower fire-rate when compared to its semi-auto packmate, it quickly proves itself when competing for range and accuracy against it. This causes the weapon to still attract Avali sharpshooters that seek something reliable and simple to arm themselves with.

ThingDef.label: Independent Worlds assault rifle
ThingDef.description: A non-Illuminate assault rifle. Choosing fire-power over accuracy, this weapon releases a burst of four shots before the user has to zero in again due to recoil. Whilst it doesn’t receive the same love from Avali sharpshooters that the other rifles receive, it certainly finds its favour by Avali who prefer more suppressing fire.

ThingDef.label: Independent Worlds light machine gun
ThingDef.description: A rapid-fire non-Illuminate LMG. Throwing away more popular doctrines of accuracy and controllability. This weapon is capable of firing enough projectiles to make a certain area wholly suppressed. Whilst it certainly has this high fire-power, this comes at the expense of the Avali wielder who needs time to zero it in again after usage.

ThingDef.label: Independent Worlds machine gun
ThingDef.description: A more general purpose non-Illuminate machine gun. When compared to its lighter packmate, this machine gun already comes with more accuracy and a heavier bullet. Whilst this may be the case, it generally has less range compared to it and the advised burst is also lowered for more controllability.

ThingDef.label: Independent Worlds sub-machine gun
ThingDef.description: A regular old non-Illuminate SMG. Whilst generally better in close quarters or when closing in on your target, its fire-rate is the thing that makes up for this fact. This weapon is best used in shorter ranges or maybe just a way to protect yourself from melee based attackers, or an alternative to melee attacks of your own.

ThingDef.label: Independent Worlds rail rifle
ThingDef.description: A non-Illuminate Anti-Tank rail rifle. Together with its lengthy coil system and its dense projectile, this rifle will punch a hole through most armoured targets and will do the same to unarmoured targets — with overpenetration, mind you.

ThingDef.label: Independent Worlds revolver
ThingDef.description: A Terran influenced non-Illuminate revolver. Despite its non-Avali nature, this cylinder shooter still shouldn’t be mistaken for a kit’s toy to the same kin that designed it. Sporting short range accuracy and a punchy bullet, it’s a good weapon for an Avali that wants an easy to both maintain and make weapon.

ThingDef.label: Illuminate Scythe
ThingDef.description: A high-tech Illuminate scythe. Unlike most Ferrogel weapons, this one’s blade isn’t actually supposed to break in the target. Despite this it still has an advanced printer in the blade’s base to replace it when it gets dull. Whilst its viability for actual combat is questionable, being attacked by this weapon is still going to deal great damage.

ThingDef.label: Illuminate Axe
ThingDef.description: A dangerous Illuminate battle axe. Truly meant for combat, this weapon uses vibrations to cut into the skin of the enemy, after multiple hits the blade will break off and stick in its target’s flesh before rapidly being reconstructed by the printer in its head. It is renowned for its brutality and the surprising force an Avali can strike down with it.

ThingDef.label: Illuminate knife
ThingDef.description: A small Illuminate survival knife. Whilst primarily used together with its vibrating blade as a tool to cut food and small objects with, it is still a dangerous hold-out weapon, able to use its vibrating blade to cut through an enemy with ease and being able to reprint the blade when it shatters in the enemy or simply gets too dull with just the same amount of ease.

ThingDef.label: Illuminate Spear
ThingDef.description: An elegant and long Illuminate spear. Being popular for both the low amount of training required and the large amount of ferrogel able to be stored in it to reprint its head with. It is perhaps the most viable weapon to train beginners with but is also dangerous in the talons of masters with its sharp and explicitly fragile head.

ThingDef.label: Illuminate Viroblade
ThingDef.description: The renowned and highly iconic Illuminate sword. Perhaps it is the vibrating blade and the song-like hum it creates that makes it so popular. Or perhaps it is the splintering ferrogel blade instead, creating many deadly injuries. Whatever the reason may be, this blade has a legendary reputation and a bodycount to support it.
